block.p: Seven large manufacturing and energy companies joined a growing list of businesses pursuing sharp -- and voluntary -- cuts in their emissions of heat-trapping greenhouse gases. As a group, the companies, which included DuPont, Shell, and Alcan Aluminium, agreed to reduce emissions by about 90 million tons a year by 2010, which would put them 15 percent below their combined annual output a decade ago.

Seven large manufacturing and energy companies joined a growing list of businesses pursuing sharp -- and voluntary -- cuts in their emissions of heat-trapping greenhouse gases. As a group, the companies, which included DuPont, Shell, and Alcan Aluminium, agreed to reduce emissions by about 90 million tons a year by 2010, which would put them 15 percent below their combined annual output a decade ago.
They made the decision because they concluded that mandatory cuts in emissions were coming eventually, and they would gain competitive advantages by acting now.
